content.rendered:
Elementary Schools 

Academic programs at our six elementary schools reinforce and build foundational skills to challenge our students while considering their individual learning needs. Teachers and students take a cross-curricular approach to teaching and learning so that themes tie together across multiple subject areas.

Learn more about the elementary schools curriculum.

Middle School Overview

Maple Avenue Middle School focuses on the success of every student in an environment that is both supportive and academically challenging. Students at the middle school complete coursework in the core subjects of math, English, social studies, and science, as well as art, music, technology, physical education, computer technology, health, world language, and family and consumer sciences.

Learn more about the middle school curriculum.

High School Overview

Saratoga Springs High School provides a comprehensive and challenging program to ensure that students will be successful in advanced educational studies, the workforce, or other post-graduate plans.

A wide variety of programs and opportunities are available to high school students to become well-rounded individuals who are college and career ready. Many opportunities to enroll in AP and college credit courses are available to high school students each year, as well as numerous courses in the fields of STEM, including a K-12 Project Lead the Way curriculum. In addition, students can choose to attend career and technical education programs or Early College High School programs to gain real-world experience.

Learn more about the high school curriculum.
